intro: Verena hassleriana, commonly known as the alpine verena, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Verena hassleriana is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
